name: Red Deer
description: The red deer is one of the largest deer species. A male red deer is called a stag, while a female is a hind. Red deer are known for their impressive antlers and are a prized trophy for hunters.

name: Roe Deer
description: Roe deer are relatively small, reddish and grey-brown deer. They are widespread and often seen at dusk and dawn. Their small size makes them challenging targets.

name: Fallow Deer
description: Fallow deer are easily recognizable by their distinctive palmate antlers and spotted coat. They are social animals often found in herds.

name: Wild Boar
description: Wild boar are tough and aggressive animals. They can be found in various habitats and are known for their unpredictable behavior when wounded. Exercise caution when hunting.

name: European Hare
description: The European hare is a fast and agile small game animal. They are most active during dawn and dusk, making them challenging targets despite their size.

name: European Rabbit
description: European rabbits are smaller than hares and live in burrow systems. They are social animals and excellent for practicing shooting skills.

name: Red Fox
description: Red foxes are cunning and adaptable predators. Their excellent hearing and sense of smell make them wary targets. They are most active at night.

name: European Bison
description: The European bison is the largest land mammal in Europe. These powerful animals require careful approach and powerful weapons. Only hunt with appropriate calibers.

name: Ring-Necked Pheasant
description: Ring-necked pheasants are colorful game birds known for their explosive takeoff when flushed. They prefer agricultural areas with nearby cover.

name: Mallard
description: Mallards are the most common duck species. Males have distinctive green heads. They are found near water and best hunted from blinds with decoys.

name: Greylag Goose
description: Greylag geese are large waterfowl that travel in flocks. They are wary birds with excellent eyesight, making them challenging waterfowl targets.

name: Roosevelt Elk
description: The Roosevelt elk is the largest of the four surviving subspecies of elk in North America. Bulls can weigh over 450 kg and possess magnificent antlers. A true trophy animal.

name: Blacktail Deer
description: Blacktail deer are a subspecies of mule deer found in dense forests. They have a distinctive black tail and are known for their bounding gait when fleeing.

name: Whitetail Deer
description: Whitetail deer are one of the most popular game animals in North America. Named for their distinctive white tail, they are alert and quick to flee when threatened.

name: Black Bear
description: Black bears are powerful omnivores found in forested areas. Despite their name, they can be various colors. They require careful stalking and appropriate weaponry.

name: Coyote
description: Coyotes are intelligent and adaptable predators. They are known for their distinctive howl and cunning hunting behavior. They have excellent senses and are wary of humans.

name: Canada Goose
description: Canada geese are large waterfowl with distinctive black heads and white chin straps. They travel in V-formations and are commonly found near lakes and rivers.

name: Merriam Turkey
description: Merriam turkeys are a subspecies of wild turkey known for their striking appearance. They have excellent eyesight and hearing, making them challenging to hunt. Use calls and decoys.

name: Harlequin Duck
description: Harlequin ducks are small, colorful sea ducks found in fast-flowing streams and coastal waters. Males have distinctive blue-grey and chestnut plumage with white markings.

name: Brown Bear
description: The brown bear is one of the most dangerous animals to hunt. Extremely powerful and potentially aggressive, it requires careful planning, tracking skills, and powerful weapons. Not for inexperienced hunters.

name: Eurasian Lynx
description: The Eurasian lynx is a medium-sized cat with distinctive ear tufts. They are solitary, elusive predators that are rarely seen. Their spotted coat provides excellent camouflage.

name: Moose
description: Moose are the largest members of the deer family. Bulls have massive palmate antlers and can be aggressive during the rut. They prefer areas near water and willow thickets.

name: Reindeer
description: Reindeer, also known as caribou in North America, are well-adapted to cold climates. Both males and females have antlers. They travel in herds across tundra and taiga regions.

name: Eurasian Wigeon
description: Eurasian wigeons are medium-sized dabbling ducks. Males have a distinctive rusty head with a cream crown. They are commonly found on lakes and marshes.

name: Black Grouse
description: Black grouse are large game birds known for their elaborate courtship displays. Males have distinctive lyre-shaped tail feathers. They inhabit forest edges and moorlands.

name: Hazel Grouse
description: Hazel grouse are small, cryptically colored forest birds. They are shy and difficult to spot among the undergrowth. They prefer mixed forests with dense cover.

name: Tundra Bean Goose
description: Tundra bean geese are migratory waterfowl that breed in the Arctic tundra. They are wary birds with excellent eyesight and often travel in large flocks.

name: Eurasian Teal
description: Eurasian teal are the smallest dabbling ducks. Males have distinctive green and chestnut head markings. They are fast, agile fliers that prefer shallow wetlands.
